title: Designing Digital Mathematics Training Modules Based on Multimedia Learning Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding elementary to intermediate-level mathematical concepts, experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Job-integrated mathematics training course for current practitioners, with personalized learning environments using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Using multimedia materials, learners can solve complex math problems in three stages: audiovisual analysis, conceptual structuring, and practical application.
In module-based interactive simulations, learners can visually explain mathematical principles with 90% or higher accuracy.
Through formative assessment feedback systems in digital training modules, individual learning gaps can be improved by 50% or more within two weeks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
